004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.hal.DriverStationJNI;
008import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.BooleanEvent;
009import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.EventLoop;
010import java.util.HashMap;
011import java.util.Map;
012
013/**
014 * Handle input from standard HID devices connected to the Driver Station.
015 *
016 * <p>This class handles standard input that comes from the Driver Station. Each time a value is
017 * requested the most recent value is returned. There is a single class instance for each device and
018 * the mapping of ports to hardware buttons depends on the code in the Driver Station.
019 */
020public class GenericHID {
021  /** Represents a rumble output on the JoyStick. */
022  public enum RumbleType {
023    kLeftRumble,
024    kRightRumble
025  }
026
027  public enum HIDType {
028    kUnknown(-1),
029    kXInputUnknown(0),
030    kXInputGamepad(1),
031    kXInputWheel(2),
032    kXInputArcadeStick(3),
033    kXInputFlightStick(4),
034    kXInputDancePad(5),
035    kXInputGuitar(6),
036    kXInputGuitar2(7),
037    kXInputDrumKit(8),
038    kXInputGuitar3(11),
039    kXInputArcadePad(19),
040    kHIDJoystick(20),
041    kHIDGamepad(21),
042    kHIDDriving(22),
043    kHIDFlight(23),
044    kHID1stPerson(24);
045
046    public final int value;
047
048    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
049    private static final Map<Integer, HIDType> map = new HashMap<>();
050
051    HIDType(int value) {
052      this.value = value;
053    }
054
055    static {
056      for (HIDType hidType : HIDType.values()) {
057        map.put(hidType.value, hidType);
058      }
059    }
060
061    public static HIDType of(int value) {
062      return map.get(value);
063    }
064  }
065
066  private final int m_port;
067  private int m_outputs;
068  private short m_leftRumble;
069  private short m_rightRumble;
070
071  /**
072   * Construct an instance of a device.
073   *
074   * @param port The port index on the Driver Station that the device is plugged into.
075   */
076  public GenericHID(int port) {
077    m_port = port;
078  }
079
080  /**
081   * Get the button value (starting at button 1).
082   *
083   * <p>The buttons are returned in a single 16 bit value with one bit representing the state of
084   * each button. The appropriate button is returned as a boolean value.
085   *
086   * <p>This method returns true if the button is being held down at the time that this method is
087   * being called.
088   *
089   * @param button The button number to be read (starting at 1)
090   * @return The state of the button.
091   */
092  public boolean getRawButton(int button) {
093    return DriverStation.getStickButton(m_port, (byte) button);
094  }
095
096  /**
097   * Whether the button was pressed since the last check. Button indexes begin at 1.
098   *
099   * <p>This method returns true if the button went from not pressed to held down since the last
100   * time this method was called. This is useful if you only want to call a function once when you
101   * press the button.
102   *
103   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
104   * @return Whether the button was pressed since the last check.
105   */
106  public boolean getRawButtonPressed(int button) {
107    return DriverStation.getStickButtonPressed(m_port, (byte) button);
108  }
109
110  /**
111   * Whether the button was released since the last check. Button indexes begin at 1.
112   *
113   * <p>This method returns true if the button went from held down to not pressed since the last
114   * time this method was called. This is useful if you only want to call a function once when you
115   * release the button.
116   *
117   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
118   * @return Whether the button was released since the last check.
119   */
120  public boolean getRawButtonReleased(int button) {
121    return DriverStation.getStickButtonReleased(m_port, button);
122  }
123
124  /**
125   * Constructs an event instance around this button's digital signal.
126   *
127   * @param button the button index
128   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
129   * @return an event instance representing the button's digital signal attached to the given loop.
130   */
131  public BooleanEvent button(int button, EventLoop loop) {
132    return new BooleanEvent(loop, () -> getRawButton(button));
133  }
134
135  /**
136   * Get the value of the axis.
137   *
138   * @param axis The axis to read, starting at 0.
139   * @return The value of the axis.
140   */
141  public double getRawAxis(int axis) {
142    return DriverStation.getStickAxis(m_port, axis);
143  }
144
145  /**
146   * Get the angle in degrees of a POV on the HID.
147   *
148   * <p>The POV angles start at 0 in the up direction, and increase clockwise (eg right is 90,
149   * upper-left is 315).
150   *
151   * @param pov The index of the POV to read (starting at 0). Defaults to 0.
152   * @return the angle of the POV in degrees, or -1 if the POV is not pressed.
153   */
154  public int getPOV(int pov) {
155    return DriverStation.getStickPOV(m_port, pov);
156  }
157
158  /**
159   * Get the angle in degrees of the default POV (index 0) on the HID.
160   *
161   * <p>The POV angles start at 0 in the up direction, and increase clockwise (eg right is 90,
162   * upper-left is 315).
163   *
164   * @return the angle of the POV in degrees, or -1 if the POV is not pressed.
165   */
166  public int getPOV() {
167    return getPOV(0);
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Constructs a BooleanEvent instance based around this angle of a POV on the HID.
172   *
173   * <p>The POV angles start at 0 in the up direction, and increase clockwise (eg right is 90,
174   * upper-left is 315).
175   *
176   * @param angle POV angle in degrees, or -1 for the center / not pressed.
177   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
178   * @return a BooleanEvent instance based around this angle of a POV on the HID.
179   */
180  public BooleanEvent pov(int angle, EventLoop loop) {
181    return pov(0, angle, loop);
182  }
183
184  /**
185   * Constructs a BooleanEvent instance based around this angle of a POV on the HID.
186   *
187   * <p>The POV angles start at 0 in the up direction, and increase clockwise (eg right is 90,
188   * upper-left is 315).
189   *
190   * @param pov index of the POV to read (starting at 0). Defaults to 0.
191   * @param angle POV angle in degrees, or -1 for the center / not pressed.
192   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
193   * @return a BooleanEvent instance based around this angle of a POV on the HID.
194   */
195  public BooleanEvent pov(int pov, int angle, EventLoop loop) {
196    return new BooleanEvent(loop, () -> getPOV(pov) == angle);
197  }
198
199  /**
200   * Constructs a BooleanEvent instance based around the 0-degree angle (up) of the default (index
201   * 0) POV on the HID.
202   *
203   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
204   * @return a BooleanEvent instance based around the 0-degree angle of a POV on the HID.
205   */
206  public BooleanEvent povUp(EventLoop loop) {
207    return pov(0, loop);
208  }
209
210  /**
211   * Constructs a BooleanEvent instance based around the 45-degree angle (right up) of the default
212   * (index 0) POV on the HID.
213   *
214   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
215   * @return a BooleanEvent instance based around the 45-degree angle of a POV on the HID.
216   */
217  public BooleanEvent povUpRight(EventLoop loop) {
218    return pov(45, loop);
219  }
220
221  /**
222   * Constructs a BooleanEvent instance based around the 90-degree angle (right) of the default
223   * (index 0) POV on the HID.
224   *
225   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
226   * @return a BooleanEvent instance based around the 90-degree angle of a POV on the HID.
227   */
228  public BooleanEvent povRight(EventLoop loop) {
229    return pov(90, loop);
230  }
231
232  /**
233   * Constructs a BooleanEvent instance based around the 135-degree angle (right down) of the
234   * default (index 0) POV on the HID.
235   *
236   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
237   * @return a BooleanEvent instance based around the 135-degree angle of a POV on the HID.
238   */
239  public BooleanEvent povDownRight(EventLoop loop) {
240    return pov(135, loop);
241  }
242
243  /**
244   * Constructs a BooleanEvent instance based around the 180-degree angle (down) of the default
245   * (index 0) POV on the HID.
246   *
247   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
248   * @return a BooleanEvent instance based around the 180-degree angle of a POV on the HID.
249   */
250  public BooleanEvent povDown(EventLoop loop) {
251    return pov(180, loop);
252  }
253
254  /**
255   * Constructs a BooleanEvent instance based around the 225-degree angle (down left) of the default
256   * (index 0) POV on the HID.
257   *
258   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
259   * @return a BooleanEvent instance based around the 225-degree angle of a POV on the HID.
260   */
261  public BooleanEvent povDownLeft(EventLoop loop) {
262    return pov(225, loop);
263  }
264
265  /**
266   * Constructs a BooleanEvent instance based around the 270-degree angle (left) of the default
267   * (index 0) POV on the HID.
268   *
269   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
270   * @return a BooleanEvent instance based around the 270-degree angle of a POV on the HID.
271   */
272  public BooleanEvent povLeft(EventLoop loop) {
273    return pov(270, loop);
274  }
275
276  /**
277   * Constructs a BooleanEvent instance based around the 315-degree angle (left up) of the default
278   * (index 0) POV on the HID.
279   *
280   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
281   * @return a BooleanEvent instance based around the 315-degree angle of a POV on the HID.
282   */
283  public BooleanEvent povUpLeft(EventLoop loop) {
284    return pov(315, loop);
285  }
286
287  /**
288   * Constructs a BooleanEvent instance based around the center (not pressed) of the default (index
289   * 0) POV on the HID.
290   *
291   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
292   * @return a BooleanEvent instance based around the center of a POV on the HID.
293   */
294  public BooleanEvent povCenter(EventLoop loop) {
295    return pov(-1, loop);
296  }
297
298  /**
299   * Get the number of axes for the HID.
300   *
301   * @return the number of axis for the current HID
302   */
303  public int getAxisCount() {
304    return DriverStation.getStickAxisCount(m_port);
305  }
306
307  /**
308   * For the current HID, return the number of POVs.
309   *
310   * @return the number of POVs for the current HID
311   */
312  public int getPOVCount() {
313    return DriverStation.getStickPOVCount(m_port);
314  }
315
316  /**
317   * For the current HID, return the number of buttons.
318   *
319   * @return the number of buttons for the current HID
320   */
321  public int getButtonCount() {
322    return DriverStation.getStickButtonCount(m_port);
323  }
324
325  /**
326   * Get if the HID is connected.
327   *
328   * @return true if the HID is connected
329   */
330  public boolean isConnected() {
331    return DriverStation.isJoystickConnected(m_port);
332  }
333
334  /**
335   * Get the type of the HID.
336   *
337   * @return the type of the HID.
338   */
339  public HIDType getType() {
340    return HIDType.of(DriverStation.getJoystickType(m_port));
341  }
342
343  /**
344   * Get the name of the HID.
345   *
346   * @return the name of the HID.
347   */
348  public String getName() {
349    return DriverStation.getJoystickName(m_port);
350  }
351
352  /**
353   * Get the axis type of a joystick axis.
354   *
355   * @param axis The axis to read, starting at 0.
356   * @return the axis type of a joystick axis.
357   */
358  public int getAxisType(int axis) {
359    return DriverStation.getJoystickAxisType(m_port, axis);
360  }
361
362  /**
363   * Get the port number of the HID.
364   *
365   * @return The port number of the HID.
366   */
367  public int getPort() {
368    return m_port;
369  }
370
371  /**
372   * Set a single HID output value for the HID.
373   *
374   * @param outputNumber The index of the output to set (1-32)
375   * @param value The value to set the output to
376   */
377  public void setOutput(int outputNumber, boolean value) {
378    m_outputs = (m_outputs & ~(1 << (outputNumber - 1))) | ((value ? 1 : 0) << (outputNumber - 1));
379    DriverStationJNI.setJoystickOutputs((byte) m_port, m_outputs, m_leftRumble, m_rightRumble);
380  }
381
382  /**
383   * Set all HID output values for the HID.
384   *
385   * @param value The 32 bit output value (1 bit for each output)
386   */
387  public void setOutputs(int value) {
388    m_outputs = value;
389    DriverStationJNI.setJoystickOutputs((byte) m_port, m_outputs, m_leftRumble, m_rightRumble);
390  }
391
392  /**
393   * Set the rumble output for the HID. The DS currently supports 2 rumble values, left rumble and
394   * right rumble.
395   *
396   * @param type Which rumble value to set
397   * @param value The normalized value (0 to 1) to set the rumble to
398   */
399  public void setRumble(RumbleType type, double value) {
400    if (value < 0) {
401      value = 0;
402    } else if (value > 1) {
403      value = 1;
404    }
405    if (type == RumbleType.kLeftRumble) {
406      m_leftRumble = (short) (value * 65535);
407    } else {
408      m_rightRumble = (short) (value * 65535);
409    }
410    DriverStationJNI.setJoystickOutputs((byte) m_port, m_outputs, m_leftRumble, m_rightRumble);
411  }
412}
